Tourists from across the globe visit Spain to witness the annual La Tomatina Festival in the region. Having attained huge popularity worldwide, the ‘tomato fight’ event distinguishes itself from any other occasion and is enjoy by many. The occasion starts from a week before where preparations are in full-swing with lots of partying and a paella cooking contest held just the night before the actual event day. The “palo jabon” marks the start of the festival where organizers put up a greased pole with ham on top. The concept is to climb the pole and knock the ham off to kick start the tomato fight. At about 11am a shot is sounded to start the festival. Crushed tomatoes from large trucks are then thrown at the huge crowd of people waiting to start the ‘fight’!
There are thousands of tourists that visit Spain during this time of the year to experience the La Tomatina Festival. The atmosphere is lively and eccentric which attracts many partygoers to the place. People are seen wearing goggles and gloves that protect them from the tomato juice that fills the streets and covers every building in the place. While the actual tomato fight lasts for just an hour, it is actually one event that is looked forward to with great anticipation.
